Routes¶

resources.routers.auth_routes.login()¶

Authenticate a user and log them in.

Expects a JSON payload with:

  • email (str): User email

  • password (str): User password

Returns:

Response object with status 200 on success

Return type:

flask.Response

Raises:

  • BadRequest – if request body is invalid

  • Unauthorized – if email or password is incorrect

resources.routers.auth_routes.logout()¶

Log out the currently authenticated user.

Returns:

Response object with status 200 on successful logout

Return type:

flask.Response

resources.routers.project_routes.create_project(body)¶

Create a new project. Only accessible by managers.

Parameters:

body (ProjectRequest) – ProjectRequest object containing project details

Returns:

JSON representation of the created project

Return type:

dict

Raises:

BadRequest – if request body is invalid

resources.routers.project_routes.create_task(project_id, body)¶

Create a new task under a project. Only accessible by managers.

Parameters:

  • project_id (int) – ID of the parent project

  • body (TaskRequest) – TaskRequest object with task details

Returns:

JSON representation of the created task

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • NotFound – if parent project does not exist

  • BadRequest – if request body is invalid

resources.routers.project_routes.delete_project(project_id)¶

Delete a project by ID. Only accessible by managers.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – ID of the project to delete

Returns:

Response with deletion confirmation

Return type:

flask.Response

Raises:

NotFound – if project with given ID does not exist

resources.routers.project_routes.get_project(project_id)¶

Retrieve a single project by ID.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – ID of the project

Returns:

Project details in JSON format

Return type:

dict

Raises:

NotFound – if project with given ID does not exist

resources.routers.project_routes.get_projects()¶

Retrieve all projects.

Returns:

List of projects in JSON format

Return type:

list[dict]

resources.routers.project_routes.get_tasks_by_project(project_id)¶

Retrieve all tasks for a specific project.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – ID of the project

Returns:

List of tasks in JSON format

Return type:

list[dict]

Raises:

NotFound – if project with given ID does not exist

resources.routers.project_routes.update_project(project_id, body)¶

Update an existing project. Only accessible by managers.

Parameters:

  • project_id (int) – ID of the project to update

  • body (ProjectRequest) – ProjectRequest object with updated project data

Returns:

Updated project details in JSON format

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • NotFound – if project with given ID does not exist

  • BadRequest – if request body is invalid

resources.routers.user_routes.create_user(body)¶

Create a new user. Only accessible by managers.

Parameters:

body (CreateUserRequest) – CreateUserRequest object containing user data

Returns:

JSON representation of the created user

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • BadRequest – if request body is invalid

  • Conflict – if user email already exists

resources.routers.user_routes.delete_user(user_id)¶

Delete a user by ID. Only accessible by managers.

Parameters:

user_id (int) – ID of the user to delete

Returns:

Response with deletion confirmation

Return type:

flask.Response

Raises:

  • NotFound – if user with given ID does not exist

  • UnprocessableEntity – if trying to delete the currently logged-in user

resources.routers.user_routes.get_user(user_id)¶

Retrieve a single user by ID.

Parameters:

user_id (int) – ID of the user

Returns:

User details in JSON format

Return type:

dict

Raises:

NotFound – if user with given ID does not exist

resources.routers.user_routes.get_users()¶

Retrieve all users.

Returns:

List of users in JSON format

Return type:

list[dict]

resources.routers.user_routes.update_user(user_id, body)¶

Update an existing user. Only accessible by managers.

Parameters:

  • user_id (int) – ID of the user to update

  • body (UpdateUserRequest) – UpdateUserRequest object with updated user data

Returns:

Updated user details in JSON format

Return type:

dict

Raises:

  • BadRequest – if request body is invalid

  • NotFound – if user with given ID does not exist
